div.p: As per Governor Murphy, New Jersey schools will remain closed through at least Friday, May 15th. Please see the above headline for a message from our Superintendent, Dr. Campisi. Thank you and stay safe.

a.title: Go to comments for Update from Dr. Campisi - April 16th

div.p: Have a talent yearning to seen? Ready to show your classmates? Then let's do this! Check out the headline above for more information on our BCS Virtual Talent Show!

a.title: Go to comments for BCS Presents...A Virtual Talent Show!

img.alt: Flipgrid - Read Alouds with Ms. Filippone!

a.span: Flipgrid - Read Alouds with Ms. Filippone!

div.p: Reading is honestly the best...and being read to...? Even better! See the headline above and join Ms. Filippone as she reads aloud books designed to delight all ages! Just click and then enter the code: filippone1099. Be sure to check back often as Ms. Filippone will be posting new stories regularly. Open your mind...and open a book. Enjoy!

a.title: Go to comments for Flipgrid - Read Alouds with Ms. Filippone!

div.p: In an effort to streamline some of the Special Area plans that were shared yesterday, BCS has developed a site to access it all from one platform, along with other important information for your reference. Please see the headline at the top to visit the BCS Preparedness Plan website. Thank you for your patience and support.

a.title: Go to comments for BCS Preparedness Plan

div.p: New to Google Classroom? Just having trouble logging in? Click the headline to view a short tutorial.

a.title: Go to comments for Google Classroom Tutorial

div.p: Having issues with your iPad? Don't stress - try these troubleshooting tips! Click that headline above and increase your tech savviness!

a.title: Go to comments for iPad Troubleshooting Tips
Go to comments for March 16, 2020 2:00PM Important Remote Teaching Update

img.alt: Please Read - Message from the Child Study Team

a.span: Please Read - Message from the Child Study Team

div.p: Please see the above headline for an important message from our Child Study Team's Supervisor, Mrs. Braidwood, with information on annual reviews and other meetings, as well as your child's remote learning. Thank you!

a.title: Go to comments for Please Read - Message from the Child Study Team

div.p: Looking for more remote learning opportunities? Click the above headline to see exciting websites, compiled from Mr. Ford!

a.title: Go to comments for Remote Learning Opportunities

img.alt: BCS District Calendar for 2020-2021 School Year

a.span: BCS District Calendar for 2020-2021 School Year

div.p: It's already time to look ahead at the next coming school year. Please see the headline above to visit the BCS District Calendar for 2020-2021. Thank you!

a.title: Go to comments for BCS District Calendar for 2020-2021 School Year

img.alt: Hershey and Graduation Information for 8th Grade

a.span: Hershey and Graduation Information for 8th Grade

div.p: Attention Parents/Guardians of 8th Graders! Check out the headline above for information on the Hershey Park Trip and Graduation. It's such an exciting time!

a.title: Go to comments for Hershey and Graduation Information for 8th Grade

div.p: Yes indeed! It's that time already! Click the above headline for information on how to order your yearbook. Let's preserve our great memories together!

a.title: Go to comments for Yearbooks - Order Yours Today!

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

strong.a: Click to viewSuperintendent's All Star Blog.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.em: The mission of the Berlin Community School, in an active partnership between school and community, is to provide effective and comprehensive educational opportunities in a nurturing environment designed to challenge all students to strive for personal excellence and responsible citizenship. This will foster the pursuit of life-long learning while achieving proficiency in the New Jersey Student Learning Standards and meet the challenges of an evolving global society.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

br.span: The Board believes that a safe and civil environment in school is necessary for students to learn and achieve high academic standards. Since students learn by example, school administrators, faculty, staff, and volunteers are required to demonstrate appropriate behavior, treating others with civility and respect, and refusing to tolerate harassment, intimidation or bullying. Harassment, intimidation or bullying, like other disruptive or violent behaviors, is conduct that disrupts both a student's ability to learn and a school's ability to educate its students in a safe environment. Therefore, the school district will not tolerate acts of harassment, intimidation or bullying.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

a.strong: Guidance for Schools on Implementing the Anti-Bullying Bill of Rights Act

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: HIB is defined in both the law and Board policy as: Any gesture or written, verbal or physical act or any electronic communication which is (i) motivated by any actual or perceived characteristic such as race, color, religion, ancestry, nation origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, or disability, or any other distinguishing characteristic(s); and (ii) which takes place on school property, on a school bus, at a school sponsored or related event or even off school grounds in certain circumstances And that: a. A reasonable person should know, under the circumstances, that the actions will physically or emotionally harm the student or damage the student's property, that the actions would place a student in reasonable fear of physical or emotional harm to his person or property; or b. has the effect of insulting or demeaning the student or groups of students, or c. interferes with the students education, or is severe or pervasive enough that it causes physical or emotional harm to a student.

span.a: H.I.B. (Harassment, Intimidation, and Bullying) Frequently Asked Questions

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.div: Harassment, intimidation, and bullying will not be tolerated in the Berlin Borough School District. To assist parents and students in reportingalleged harassment, intimidation, or bullying that occurred on school property; at a school-sponsored event, or activity off of school property; on a school bus; or on the way to/from school, or through any means of electronic communication (cell phone/e-mail/internet/pager,) in the current school year, the Berlin Borough School District has developed the following form to report any instances of harrasment, intimidation, or bullying.If you wish to remain anonymous, you do not have to state your name.

div.p: There are no upcoming events to display.
